hints.content:
To find how tall the $\blueE{\text{Maple tree}}$ and $\maroonD{\text{Aspen tree}}$ are together, we need to find the total.  So, we add.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ecfb5fbb77739efa0c6f5425fc845becb398eb3a)

$\blueE{52}\text{ feet}  + \maroonD{39}\text{ feet} =\purpleD{\square}\text{ feet}$

Let's add to find the total.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d74d805eca7f477fac4bc355bf21bccd3d048657)


$\blueE{52}\text{ feet}  + \maroonD{39}\text{ feet} =\purpleD{91}\text{ feet}$
The maple and aspen tree measure $\purpleD{91}\text{ ft}$ combined.

question.content:
Nancy measures the heights of different trees in the forest.

Tree | Height
- | - | -
Maple | $52 \text { ft}$ 
Red pine | $75 \text { ft}$ 
Aspen |  $39 \text { ft}$ 

**What is the height of the Maple tree and Aspen tree combined?**  

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] $\text{ft}$
